headline: Find models.yaml relative to repo root in local.py (#98)
body: Allows invoking local.py from repo root.
author: areusch

headline: gitignore .aws directory in repo root (#95)
body: Other branches of tvm may not ignore this.
author: areusch

headline: Fix scorecard/local.py when git sha1 is numbers only (#96)
body:
Recently got this error when running `local.py`:

```
'in <string>' requires string as left operand, not int
```

Fixes this issue by changing the quoting used in the `aws ecr` filter.
author: areusch

headline: [scorecard] Use A10G runners (#74)
body:
This changes the CI to run on aws instances with A10G GPUs rather than
T4s.
author: driazati

headline: [ci] Don't cancel builds on `relax` (#93)
body:
PR builds cancel previous, still running PR builds but we don't want
that behavior on our main branch (which is `relax` here, not `main`)

body:
These are both currently failing in CI:
https://gitlab.com/octoml/relax-scorecard-ci2/-/pipelines/835704862

This also bumps the timeout to 2 hours (from 1 hour) to account for
increased runtime due to tuning

merge and felt bad that he'd need to deal with the fallout so I
cherry-picked on top of the new head for him.

headline: [scorecard] Use a separate build directory and stable images (#88)
body:
This adds 2 things:
    1. Builds in `build-scorecard` to not pollute `build` for local runs
    2. Determines a stable image (i.e. one that doesn't change from
       run-to-run dynamically by searching ECR for one built from the
       base commit with `relax`.

---------

Co-authored-by: Andrew Reusch <areusch@octoml.ai>

headline: TUZ-145 Use ONNX node id in span in frontend (#65)
body:
* Logs an identifying name to an IRModule attribute
"tvm-frontend-op-ids"
 * When possible (it's legal for an ONNX NodeProto to have an empty
   name), uses the name from the NodeProto to identify the op. When
   name is empty, uses the index of the NodeProto.

headline: [scorecard] Use local relax rather than `main` (#73)
body:
This includes a number of fixes on top of the initial scorecard infra,
mainly to enable using the local relax version from the current
branch/PR rather than checking out a fresh one from `main`.
author: driazati

headline: [Octo] Enable fusion passes and other optimizations (#77)
body:
This PR turns on several folding and fusion passes that have a fairly
dramatic impact on performance. It includes several fixes from @psrivas2
and a new pass for explicitly setting the fusion pattern of operators,
which is helpful for things like layer_norm that aren't being properly
set automatically.
author: Josh Fromm

headline: Profile all cutlass kernels and use correct shapes (#70)
body:
This PR fixed shapes used for profiling cutlass and updated config to
profile all cutlasses (this will take more tuning time for kernel
selection)

cc @jwfromm
author: vinx13

headline: [Frontend] Fuse some of the matmuls in attention (#69)
body:
Our attention importer could be more efficient by grouping the Q, K, and
V matmuls. This translates to a pretty sizeable speedup for attention
based models.
author: Josh Fromm

headline: [Unity] Merge with upstream (#68)
body: We need to grab a few changes to enable the scorecard.
author: Josh Fromm

headline: [Octo] Add optional tuning argument for extra optimization (#67)
body:
Xiyou and I have found that applying a small amount of tuning to
operators not offloaded to cutlass can yield a significant performance
boost. Just a few minutes of tuning on spacev5 for example halves the
runtime. This PR exposes the `tuning_steps` argument to `octo.compile`
to make it easier to experiment with metaschedule tuning.
author: Josh Fromm

headline: [Tuning] Skip Thread-Binded Tasks (#66)
body:
For tasks like `cumsum` where it has been scheduled before tuning pass,
we need to skip this task instead of triggering a failure for lack of
support. This PR introduced a similar check as in `DefaultGPUSchedule`
pass to skip such tasks.

CC: @sunggg @jwfromm
author: zxybazh

headline: [Frontend] Add attach_span to a few of the new operators (#64)
body:
Some of the recently added new operators didn't include `attach_span`,
this quick PR adds it so they pass all tests.
author: Josh Fromm

headline: [Unity][ONNX] Apply `R.nn.attention` in Onnx Attention OP (#62)
body:
This PR refactors the frontend impl of Onnx attention op, to apply the
`R.nn.attention`. So we are able to use the cutlass BYOC with Onnx
frontend, or other backends for `R.nn.attention` in the future. And this
PR adds more support over Onnx attention op inputs and attributes.
author: cyx-6

headline: [Relax][ONNX] Add ArgMax and ArgMin ops (#51)
body:
ArgMax and ArgMin operations were added to ONNX front-end of Relax.
Corresponding tests were added to CI

cc @jwfromm

---------

Co-authored-by: Valery Chernov <valery.chernov@deelvin.com>
author: vvchernov

headline: [Relax][ONNX] Add Exp op (#28)
body:
Add exp operation to ONNX front-end of Relax

---------

Co-authored-by: Valery Chernov <valery.chernov@deelvin.com>

headline: [Unity] Merge with tvm/unity plus a few fixes (#63)
body:
Grab a few recent changes off tvm/unity and incorporate some fixes that
were preventing all high priority models from running ith layout
transformation.
author: Josh Fromm

headline: Minor fixes to enable all models with layout transform
author: Josh Fromm

headline: [Unity][TVMScript] Update GlobalVar `checked_type_` when `emit_te` (#…
body:
…14367)

The current GlobalVar generated by `emit_te` has empty `checked_type_`,
which will fail at the well-formed check, saying

```
Warning: This IR is not well formed: The checked_type_ of Expr I.GlobalVar("add") is nullptr.
```

This PR fixes this issue and enables well-formed checks in parser tests.
author: Hzfengsy

headline: [Unity] Add More Ops For FX Translator (#14348)
body:
This PR makes 2 changes:
1. Add Relax Op Maximum and Minimum
2. Add translation function for torch function/method silu, to, ones, full, masked_fill_, mean, rsqrt, neg, max in fx translator
author: jinhongyii

headline: [Unity][Fix] Infer Layout must support negative axes (#14365)
body: This PR fixes a bug in Infer Layout for reduction ops in when `axis` has negative indices.
author: psrivas2

headline: [Unity][Pass] Fix FuseOps error if there is no output of a given grou…
body:
…p (#14354)

This PR is to fix the FuseOps error if there is no output of a given group,
although the pass `DeadCodeElimination` can solve the problem, it is better
to enhance the robustness of the pass `FuseOps`.
author: Hzfengsy

headline: [Unity][WEB] Support async pipeline creation (#14362)
body:
This PR enables async pipeline creation in webgpu module loading.
This will enable us to report progress in shader compilation
and leverage multi-threading on the host to compile shaders.
author: tqchen

headline: [Unity] Add support to append relay op attrs in translator (#14356)
body:
This PR adds an argument to the relay to relax translator to append the
relay Op Attrs as function attributes to the generated TIR PrimFuncs

This information is really useful in Relax as the absence of this
prevents us from being able schedule efficiently for ops that are
heavily sensitive to the attributes.

For example, the `groups` attribute to `conv2d` op is needed to
differentiate between regular conv2d and depthwise conv2d.
author: quic-sanirudh

headline: [Unity] Fix typo in `get_cuda_target` (#60)
body:
This PR fixes the typo in `get_cuda_target`, which is used to find the
`nvidia-smi` command.

This did also include a rebase onto tvm/main but the number of changes
is relatively small.

headline: [Unity][Fix] Fix block memory plan to handle bool (#14357)
body: This PR fixes the size calculation of storage tokens in Static Plan Block Memory pass. Prior to this PR the storage for a tensor  `R.Tensor((2, 3), dtype="bool")` would be calculated as `R.memory.alloc_storage(R.shape([1]), dtype="bool")` instead of `R.memory.alloc_storage(R.shape([6]), dtype="bool")`
author: psrivas2

headline: [Unity][Transform] AMP out_dtype=float16 testcases (#14358)
body: Add test cases to test out_dtype="float16"

… (#14350)

Check leaked intermediate variables in cutlass patterns

headline: [Unity] Support model kwargs in dynamo_capture_subgraph (#14349)
body: This PR enables user to pass the torch model's kwargs of forward function to dynamo_capture_subgraph, which makes it more flexible.
author: jinhongyii

headline: [TUZ-201] Support for end to end SpaceV5 (#58)
body:
Change to octo utility so that it will autopopulate available external
libs, so far we only check for `thrust`.

I also disable epilogue fusion of matmul for now since it restricts
batch size to 1.
author: Josh Fromm

headline: [TUZ-200] Change Slice to Relax Op (#57)
body:
This PR follows up previous effort to changing operators into relax op
implementation so that relax layout planning could be unblocked. This
one specifically changes slice into strided_slice relax op.

CC @sunggg @jwfromm
author: zxybazh

headline: [Unity] Merge with tvm/unity (#56)
body:
A few new fixes have gone into tvm/unity that would be useful for us to
grab.
author: Josh Fromm

headline: [Unity][Frontend] FX exp and strided_slice fix (#14338)
body:
* Add the support of `exp` for the FX translator.
* Previously the way FX translator dealt with `None` in torch tensor
slice (e.g., `x[:, None, None]`) is not right. This PR fixes this issue.
Specifically, the `None` here means dim expansion, and the previous impl
mistakenly increases the dim counter when seeing `None`, which will lead
to dim counter out-of-range issue in the end.
author: MasterJH5574

headline: [Unity][BYOC] Update testcases to follow recent changes (#14339)
body: This PR updates test cases to follow recent changes
author: sunggg

headline: [Unity] Remove Python interface of RemoveUnusedFunction (#14336)
body:
The pass RemoveUnusedFunctions was renamed and enhanced to the DCE pass
in #14262. This PR removes the Python interface of RemoveUnusedFunctions
in transform.py.

It is surprising that this Python API was never tested in any testing
file before.

This PR also fixes `alter_op_impl.cc` and `to_mixed_precision.cc` to for
Clang build warnings.
author: MasterJH5574

headline: [Unity][Pass] Reuse prior infra to implement more complete DCE (#14334)
body:
As a follow-up to https://github.com/apache/tvm/pull/14262, I just noticed that I previously implemented a function called `RemoveAllUnused` (https://github.com/apache/tvm/pull/14043) that can do function-wise DCE and should be more complete than https://github.com/apache/tvm/pull/14262 as `RemoveAllUnused` can also remove dead dataflow blocks (added two test-cases to show that). 

For now:
- `tvm.relax.transform.DeadCodeElimination` is the pass for running DCE over an IRModule.
- `tvm.relax.analysis.remove_all_unused` is a function for running DCE over a function.

`tvm.relax.transform.DeadCodeElimination` is implemented based on `tvm.relax.analysis.remove_all_unused`. I did not sync the function name for the two, as I saw there are other uses for `RemoveAllUnused` so just want to be conservative first.
author: ganler

headline: [Unity][Op] Fix Strided Slice Shape Inference (#14324)
body:
In the case where the begin index of strided slice is out of [-ndim, dim), the strided slice operator will yield some incorrect shape inference. This PR corrected this issue by canonicalizing the begin and end index for strided slice and calculate the symbolic shape. Added some new unit tests for out of range begin locations and changed some symbolic shape tests.

Co-authored-by: Tianqi Chen <tqchen@users.noreply.github.com>
Co-authored-by: Ruihang Lai <ruihangl@cs.cmu.edu>
author: zxybazh

headline: [Unity][Transform] DefaultSchedule pass (#14266)
body: This pr enhances introduces tir.is_scheduled to allow default schedule pass to skip some PrimFuncs.
author: spectrometerHBH

headline: [Unity][Lint] Fix cpplint casting (#14333)
body: fix: cpplint casting
author: ganler

headline: [Unity][Transform] Automatic Mixed Precision (#14242)
body:
This PR adds a new pass ToMixedPrecision to automatically cast fp32 models to fp16 when necessary.

see https://github.com/spectrometerHBH/tvm/blob/amp/src/relax/transform/to_mixed_precision.cc#L51 on how this pass works.
author: spectrometerHBH

headline: [Unity][Transform] Simple Dead Code Elimination (#14262)
body: This PR adds a new pass DeadCodeElimination, which currently removes unused local vars in df blocks.
author: spectrometerHBH

headline: [Unity][Transform] Automatic Layout Conversion (#14257)
body:
This PR adds a new pass ConvertLayout that converts the layout of conv2d operators (NCHW->NHWC) and tries to propagate this conversion when appropriate.

see https://github.com/spectrometerHBH/tvm/blob/convert-layout/src/relax/transform/convert_layout.cc#L39 on how this pass works

It works on the op level, which is in parallel with the ongoing Layout Transformation effort that works on TIR level in the community.
author: spectrometerHBH

headline: [Unity][TOPI] fp16 LayerNorm & GroupNorm (#14264)
body:
This pr modifies the topi implementation (which is also the legalizer's backend of Relax) of LayerNorm and GroupNorm operators to allow them to accept fp16 inputs, cast to fp32 internally, and produce fp16 outputs.

This can help eliminate unnecessary casts caused by AMP.
author: spectrometerHBH

headline: [Unity][Contrib] Introduce several features of cutlass profiler (#14275)
body:
- allow Conv2d using different alignment factors for input and epilogue, which can influence performance 
- store the profiler cache on disk, reducing CUTLASS profiler overhead across different runs
- use the same set of default tile configurations as CUTLASS for sm80 https://github.com/NVIDIA/cutlass/blob/master/tools/library/scripts/generator.py#L1881
author: spectrometerHBH

headline: [Unity][Transform] Enhance RewriteDataflowReshape transform (#14265)
body:
This PR enhances the current RewriteDataflowReshape transformation.

Originally, it will use loop vars to prove the equality of addresses of LHS and RHS, which will cause some cases to fail due to the limitation of the arith module.

Instead, we can just use block vars to do the proof, which is supposed to be equivalent and the expressions are simpler, which allow us to cover more cases.
author: spectrometerHBH

headline: [Unity][BYOC] Improve expressiveness of the pattern check function in…
body:
… FuseOpsByPattern (#14310)

* Change the input of FuseOpsByPattern and add check for result dependency in cutlass conv2d residual block

* Rename FuseOpsPattern to FusionPattern and PatternCheckFunctionInput to PatternCheckContext
author: yelite

headline: [Unity][BYOC] Support matmul + residual block fusion in CUTLASS BYOC …
body:
…(#14317)

* enable residual fusion support for matmul

* disallow residual fusion without bias

* support conv2d + residual add without bias via conv2d + bias pattern
author: masahi

headline: [Unity] Support pattern-based rewriting (#14312)
body:
* stub

* wip

* works

* restore binding

* attention test work

* use RemoveAllUnused

* pass original call node to callback

* clean test

* add doc

* add test for the case where the original call is returned

headline: [Unity][Web] WebGPU explicit max buffer size (#14321)
body:
This PR specifies the maximum buffer size limit of WebGPU runtime
explicitly so that the limit will not be a tight one by default.

In the future, we can analysis and detect the needed max buffer size
limit and actively request the GPU.
author: MasterJH5574

headline: [Unity][Op] Enable special dimension value 0 in reshape (#14311)
body: [Unity] Enable special dimension value 0 in reshape
author: Josh Fromm

headline: [Unity][Pass] Add a pass to alter the TIR implementation of an operat…
body:
…or (#14215)

* [Unity][Pass] Add a pass to alter the TIR
implementation of an operator (identified
by operator_kind attribute on PrimFunc).
It also inserts layout changes to i/o
buffers at Relax level.

* deep copy index map to avoid structural_equality fail

* do not mark layouts as frozen

* address comments

* fix call_tir global symbol in tests
author: psrivas2

headline: [Unity][DEBUG] Add Instrument (#14302)
body:
This PR adds an instrumentation option to the relax VM.
The instrument will be called before/after each call
instruction if specified.

We also include a testing utility that leverages uses
instrument. LibCompareVMInstrument leverages the instrument
to compare implementations on another backend.

Also updated a few places in web runtime to improve debugging.
author: tqchen

headline: [Unity][Op] Cumsum (#14297)
body:
This PR introduces the cumulative sum high-level operator.

Also replace some `T.var("int64")` with `T.int64()` in `test_ast_printer`.

We prefer these instances in CI unless there is a lot of heavy building

headline: [Unity] Consider target context for Relay to Relax conversion (#14269)

Some of Relay passes are target specific (for example, AlterOpLayout).
This commit adds target information for Relay -> Relax conversion.

headline: [Unity][Frontend] Import `tanh` and fix `layer_norm` (#14247)
body: This PR provides some quick fixes for fx_translator to import tanh and fix the error when importing torch.nn.functional.layer_norm.

headline: [Unity][BYOC] Add conv2d and residual block patterns for Relax cutlas…
body:
…s BYOC (#14252)

* Add conv2d and residual block pattern for cutlass

* Fix lint
author: yelite

headline: [Unity] Allow user defined func attrs in emit_te (#14255)
author: psrivas2

headline: [Unity][Op] Add repeat, tile, conv2d_transpose, avg_pool2d (#14238)
body:
This PR adds a series of operators for relax:
- `repeat(data: Expr, repeats: int, axis: Optional[int] = None)`
- `tile(data: Expr, repeats: Union[int, Tuple[int], List[int]])`
- `relax.nn.conv2d_transpose`
	- This operator is intended to find the gradient of conv2d w.r.t its input. For details see [pytorch document](https://pytorch.org/docs/stable/generated/torch.nn.ConvTranspose2d.html), and the document in `python/tvm/relax/op/nn/nn.py`.
	- Now TOPI support of conv2d_transpose is limited. It does not support dilations; layouts other than default; symbolic `output_padding`.
- `relax.nn.avg_pool2d`
author: Ubospica

headline: [Unity][WEB] Improve ndarray cache (#14236)
body: This PR improves NDArray cache with param sharding
author: tqchen

headline: [Unity][WEB] Update text prompts for syntactical correctness (#14237)
body: This PR fixes some punctuation in the prompts of the NDArray cache.
author: MasterJH5574

headline: [Unity][TVMScript] Fix prim_func lost issue in relax.emit_te (#14189)
body: Previously R.emit_te was introduced in https://github.com/apache/tvm/pull/14123. The `prim_func`s were not added into the same `ir_module`. The pr is to fix this issue, move some `call_tir` input handling code from `bb.call_te` to utils, then it is able to be leveraged by both `bb.emit_te` and `R.emit_te`.
author: yongwww

headline: [Unity][TVMScript] Enable Context-Aware Parsing (#14234)
body:
This PR enables context-aware parsing for TVMScript. It means that the parser has full control of the statements in the specific context/namespace.

For example, we can override the global var `__call__` method in Relax function to make sure to generate Relax Calls instead of Relay Calls.
author: Hzfengsy

headline: [Unity][Bugfix] Do not include `PrimFunc`s in the dependency graph wh…
body:
…en checking for recursion (#14228)

This PR fixes a small oversight in #14149. Namely, the analysis for detecting recursion in Relax adds all reference to global vars into the dependency graph, but some global vars might refer to TIR PrimFuncs. Those should not be in the dependency graph, and this PR ignores any that it detects.
author: slyubomirsky

headline: [Unity][Transform] SimplifyNormInference (#14221)
body:
This PR adds a new pass SimplifyNormInference to unpack the norm operator into a sequence of operators, which is same as the pass SimplifyInference in Relay.

---------

Co-authored-by: Siyuan Feng <Hzfengsy@sjtu.edu.cn>
author: SiriusNEO

headline: [Unity] Improve implementation of FuseOps (#14229)
body:
This PR improves implementation of fuse-ops so it is more deterministic.

Co-authored-by: Ruihang Lai <ruihangl@cs.cmu.edu>

headline: [Unity][WEB] Simplify WebGPU Codegen per spec (#14225)
body: This PR simplfies webgpu codegen according to spec and also PR adds utils to allow tvmjs to export runtime from a different TVM_HOME.
author: tqchen
